metadata.title: Nutrition in Living Organisms
metadata.subject: Science
metadata.description: Autotrophic and Heterotrophic nutrition, Photosynthesis, and nutrition in animals.

preAssessment.question: The process of taking in and using food is called:

concepts.title: Nutrition and its Needs
concepts.content: Nutrition is the process of taking in and using food for energy, growth, and health. Nutrients are classified into macro-nutrients (required in large quantities like carbohydrates, proteins, fats) and micro-nutrients (required in small quantities like minerals, vitamins).
concepts.funFact: The process of nutrition is continuous in all living organisms to maintain life processes!

concepts.title: Autotrophic Plants & Photosynthesis
concepts.content: Plants produce their own food using sunlight, chlorophyll, carbon dioxide from air, and water/minerals from soil. This process is called photosynthesis. The chemical equation is: 6 CO2 + 6 H2O + Sunlight -> C6H12O6 + 6 O2.
keyPoints: Light energy is converted into chemical energy
Oxygen is released as a byproduct
Phloem transports food to other parts of the plant
concepts.funFact: While most plants are green due to chlorophyll, some have other pigments but still carry out photosynthesis!

test.question: Which pigment is necessary for photosynthesis?
